segments.text: I notice the woman’s dress and apron, so neat and proper.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: She looks like she’s trying to keep everything in order, but the kitchen is falling apart.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder if she’s always this focused or if she’s just having a bad day.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Her foot is in the water, but she doesn’t even react.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think she’s just trying to get through her chores without noticing the chaos.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: She seems so alone in her task, unaware of the children’s mischief.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I hope someone helps her before she gets overwhelmed.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Her dedication to drying that plate is almost heartbreaking.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder if she’ll ever realize what’s happening around her.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: This whole scene makes me feel sorry for her.
segments.speaker: PAR
